turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: Claudia, Claudia, will you never learn? Who will we get now to finish your dress? A little practicality, cherie...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: She would sleep in my coffin, daily, curl her child's fingers round my hair as she dreamt of I know not what...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Claudia! Don't do this thing!!!

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: Louis, Louis, I gave you the gift --- help me ---

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: No... You come back to me Louis...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Are you mad????

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: You'll come home with me Louis? Fro a little while... until I am myself again.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: CLAUDIA!!!

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: I'm so glad you're here Louis... I've dreamed of your coming...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Don't try to speak... it's alright...

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: I didn't mean to let them do it... that Santiago, he tricked me...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That's all past, Lestat.

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: Yes. Past... she should never have been one of us...

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: Still beautiful Louis. You always were the strong one.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Don't fear me, Lestat. I bring you no harm.

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: You've come back to me, Louis? You've come again to me?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: It's only a siren...

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: I can't bear it Louis! The machines out there, that fly and that roar! And such lights! They make the night brighter than the day!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: And they frighten you?

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: You know I love the dark. But there's no dark anymore.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: It's false light, Lestat. It can't harm you...

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: If you stayed with me Louis, I could venture out... little by little... become the old Lestat.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I have to go now Lestat...

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: You remember how I was, Louis.. the vampire Lestat...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Yes. I remember...

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: I tried to tell you Louis... that night in Paris... when I first came to you... no-one can refuse the dark gift, Louis... not even you.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I tried...

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: And the more you tried, the more I wanted you... a vampire with your beautiful, suffering human heart. And how you suffered... I need your forgiveness, Louis.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You have it...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: So you want me to tell you the story of my life...

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: That's what I do. I interview people. I collect lives. F.M. radio. F.F.R.C. I just interviewed a genuine hero, a cop who -

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You'd have to have a lot of tape for my story. I've had a very unusual life.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: So much the better. I've got a pocket full of tapes.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You followed me here, didn't you?

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: Saw you in the street outside. You seemed interesting. Is this where you live?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: It's just a room...

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: So shall we begin?  What do yo do?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I'm a vampire.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: See? I knew you were interesting. You mean this literally, I take it?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Absolutely. I was watching you watching me. I was waiting for you in that alleyway. And then you began to speak.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: Well, what a lucky break for me.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Perhaps lucky for both of us.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: You were going to kill me? Drink my blood?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Yes but you needn't worry about that now. Things change.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: You believe this, don't you? That you're a vampire? You really think...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: We can't begin this way. Let me turn on the light.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: But I thought vampires didn't like the light.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: We love it. I only wanted to prepare you.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: How did you do that?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: The same way you do it. A series of simple gestures. Only I moved too fast for you to see. I'm flesh and blood, you see. But not human. I haven't been human for two hundred years.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What can I do to put you at ease? Shall we begin like David Copperfield? I am born, I grow up. Or shall we begin when I was born to darkness, as I call it. That's really where we should start, don't you think?

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: You're not lying to me, are you?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Why should I lie? 1791 was the year it happened. I was twenty-four - younger than you are now.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: But times were different then. I was a man at that age. The master of a large plantation just south of New Orleans...

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: You said the slave had a crucifix...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Oh, that rumour about crosses?

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: You can't look at them...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Nonsense, my friend. I can look on anything I like. And I am particularly fond of looking on crucifixes.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: The story about stakes through the heart?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: The same. As you would say today... Bull shit.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: What about coffins?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Coffins... coffins unfortunately are a necessity...

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: You loved Yvette...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Can a vampire feel love?

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: You loved your wife, surely.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I was human then. Might as well ask can an angel feel love. Both are blesses or cursed with a certain... detachment. Though whether angels take as long to learn it as I, I will never know.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Shall we go on?

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: He did it to make you stay with him!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Perhaps. He knew me. He knew I would love her more than the waking world. But there was more to it than that. Perhaps in the end he did it -- to show me that he could. For he lavished affection on her, there was no doubt about that. Life was very different with madame Claudia, as you can imagine...

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: But why did you tell her?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: How could I not? She had to know.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: And did you lose her? Did she go?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Where would she have gone? She was a child, and beautiful, heartbreaking merciless child. And I had made her that...

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: Did he die in the fire?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: He was dead to us. We were free. That was all that mattered.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: You found nothing?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Peasant rumours, superstitions about garlic, crosses, stakes in the hear, all that - how do you say again? Bull shit. But one of our kind? Not a whisper.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: No vampires in Transylvania? No Count Dracula?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Fictions, my friend. The vulgar fictions of a demented Irishman... So we repaired to Paris...

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: Lestat escaped the fire!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: He hadn't even been there. And all those years I thought he was dead.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: No... it can't end like that...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: But it has. There is no more to tell.

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: But you talk about passion, about longing, about things I'll never know in my life! It's still inside you, in every syllable you speak! And then you tell me it ends like that? Just empty?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: It's over, I'm telling you...

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: You need a new passion, Louis, a new reason to feel... what a story you've told, you don't understand yourself.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Is this what you want? You ask me for this after all I've told you?

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: If I could see what you've seen, feel what you've felt I wouldn't let it end like this! You need a like to the world out there, a connection... then it won't end like this...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Dear God. I've failed again, haven't I?

turns.speaker: MALLOY
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Don't say anymore. The reels are still turning. I have but one chance to show you the meaning of what I've said.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You haven't the vaguest conception under God of what you ask!

turns.speaker: MADELEINE
turns.text: Au contraire, monsieur, I have.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You promise to care for her then?

turns.speaker: MADELEINE
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: And you know what you ask for?

turns.speaker: MADELEINE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What do you think she is, Madeleine? A doll?

turns.speaker: MADELEINE
turns.text: A child who can't die...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: And the child who did die?

turns.speaker: MADELEINE
turns.text: My daughter...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Look at the gaslight. Don't tke your eyes off it. You will be drained to the point of death, but you must stay alive. Do you hear me?

turns.speaker: MADELEINE
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: What can I do for you?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Checking in...Karla Wilson.

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: You're in 201 and 202.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Is that bad?

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: Not at all. Those are our honeymoon suites.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Julie, we're talkin' suites!  That'll be just fine with us.

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: And, while you're here, our marginally trained, off-season staff of five will attend to your every need.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Wait...Did you say off-season?

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: July fourth weekend. Storm season starts today. The clouds roll in like clockwork.

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: Duh. The next couple of days is gonna be rough, but we'll make it.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: What about a radio?

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: Sorry. Emergencies only.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: What the hell would you call this?

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: I'd call this four spoiled city kids who wouldn't know a hurricane if it blew up their butts.  All we can do now is batten down and ride it out. If things get really bad, there's a storm shelter.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It sure is a beautiful old hotel.

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: Built in 1948 for a member of the Rockefeller clan. The tile work was imported from Spain. A lot of history in these walls...Judy Garland stayed here...Hemmingway fished for marlin right off that dock --

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Your what?

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: Honeymoon suites. I take it you kids haven't exchanged vows, yet?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: We haven't exchanged anything.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Storm season?

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: It's our version of winter.  201 and 202. There's Scrabble and Parcheesi in the lobby. Enjoy.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Listen to me. He's here.

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: Who? Who is here?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I want off this island.

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: Not possible, I'm afraid. The last ferry left hours ago. And we got a storm coming. There won't be another one for days.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Then I'll call the mainland for a charter.

turns.speaker: BROOKS
turns.text: Phones went down a few minutes ago.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You'll go away with you're college friends, but you won't go away with me?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Idiot. Idiot. Idiot.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Stupid. Stupid.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Stupid. What were you thinkng?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Jeez, Ray, fourth and forty, throw the bomb.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I should go up there. I should call her back, tell her I'm coming.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: No way, man. Surprise her. She'll be psyched.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I don't know, man. Maybe we should keep going, find a phone --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: The guy looks dead.

turns.speaker: DERRICK
turns.text: Get lost, you scared me.

turns.speaker: TITUS
turns.text: Fish are all over the water...Come on, let us take a boat out.

turns.speaker: DERRICK
turns.text: Titus, you're so stoned, you'd end up in Spain.

turns.speaker: TITUS
turns.text: That's why you'll come with Titus, mon.

turns.speaker: DERRICK
turns.text: There's a storm comin', Titus. No boats are going out.

turns.speaker: TITUS
turns.text: Storm is what makes it interesting. Thass why all the fish are up. Less hook us a couple big ones.

turns.speaker: DERRICK
turns.text: I got work to do. Take the bake elsewhere.

turns.speaker: TITUS
turns.text: Up-tighteous and self-righteous.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I thought you were out of town!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: What are you doing in my closet?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I thought you were out of town!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: What are you doing in my closet?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: i just wanted your black pants, but I'm not ready to die for them!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: That was heart attack time, Karla.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: No. When I put these skinny pants on my body...Now, that's heart attack time.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm not going anywhere. I'm fat, ugly, and depressed.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Yeah, right -- whatever.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I think I just really hurt Ray's feelings.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Listen to me, Julie. Ray's a great guy, nothing against old Ray, but he's so...Ray. I mean, he lives in Southport. Will's a nice guy, too, and he lives right down the street.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: There's nothing between Will and me.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Yet. Nothing yet.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Say yes.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: No means yes.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Tyrell, I appreciate it, but have you seen my people dance? We make the mouth face, we move the fingers --

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Karla! Did you tell him I'd be here?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Nope. I told him that you absolutely, positively would not be here at this bar between ten o'clock and eleven o'clock tonight. And then he came anyway.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: That could break the machine.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Julie, people who end up making rules like that end up beating their kids with wire hangers. It's a fact.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: The number's unlisted...

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Would you relax? We've been dating three months. He ain't stalking your butt.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Okay, okay. You're right.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I know it, and it feels good.  Hi, Ty.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: You gotta sell his butt on the Bahamas?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Ray, come on. I want us to be together.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: He's not coming. I thought he was just...

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Julie, you left four messages... Four.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: But, he said he'd try.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: He said he'd try. Try is like maybe. Try is nothing!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: He does work hard.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Work hard, huh? He's breaking your heart just because he can.  And I don't want to have to say I told you so...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Then, don't.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Hey, sorry...  He's my friend, too. And that ticket is not going to waste.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm the King of the World.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: No, I'm the King of the World.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Remind me to study real hard so someday this is normal and all that back there is somethin' I do for a weekend once every ten years.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I will, and you remind me of the same thing.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Hello? Hello?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Where is everyone? I'll ask --

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Their stuff in there...  ...and ours in here.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Karla! You promised.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I also promised Tyrell.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Am I bad? I mean, he's really great, and he's cute --

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: He's cute...And he's got a crush on you...  But...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I miss Ray...I tried to call him.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Karaoke -- perfect.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Don't even think about it.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Okay, I won't.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Not me...no way...

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Think about this, Julie. What did you actually see?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: The dockhand guy. Hanging by his neck from up there.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: You get any sleep at all?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Some.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It's okay...He doesn't believe me. That's his right. I'm starting to think I'm crazy, too.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Hey, slow down, turn off the little motor up in there...What do you say we go to the gym and work off a little stress?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Nice move.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I'll be givin' your fisherman some of that and see how he likes it.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Cancer in a box.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: No, this is the safe sun.  It's better than a day at the beach.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Karla!

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Just kidding.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm not crazy...I'm not crazy. He's here...  We've got to get to the radio and call for help.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I think we can classify this as an emergency situation.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Oh, stop it! He's dead. You killed him. Now, get over it. We gotta think here.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: They never found the body.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Julie...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Only he wasn't dead. He killed Barry and Helen last July Fourth.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Let him go. I believe him.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Come on, Julie. You saw his room.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Rio isn't the capital of Brazil. It was the wrong answer. Sorry, we lose.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I know I don't want to stay in here.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: We'll be better off in the open. If we stick together, maybe we can kill this creep for good.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Be careful, Julie.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I've got to see.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Julie, the boats are gone, the phones are down. There's no way off this place.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Then, we fight --

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I'm your best friend...You could have told me the truth about what happened. I would've understood.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Karla, I just wanted the whole thing to be over. I didn't want to involve anybody else.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: It's too late for that.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: There's no way to lock it.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Come on, you can make it.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Julie?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm right here. Grab my hand.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I'm holding your hand!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: No, you're not.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: ...Nancy?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Oh, god, it's you --

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: You're okay. Thank god.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Is he?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I got in early. I was excited...  Who was that guy?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Oh, that's Will. He's a friend. You'd like him.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Ray, we're just friend.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Every guy in history who tried to pick up a girl did the good-friend thing first.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Why are you being like this?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Ray, I can't...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Can't what?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I just feel like some part of me hasn't healed up enough to go back. Like some critical piece is missing. Please understand...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I understand something.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It's not like that. It's not you. It's me. My head. I want to go back. I want to be with you. I want to be fine. I want everything to be like it used to be.  It just isn't.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey. I'm really glad you called... I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: No, you don't have to be sorry. I'm the one --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No, I shouldn't have left so fast... I was just...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Ray, Karla won a trip to the Bahamas! An island called Tower Bay. And she wants us to come with her.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What? The Bahamas? You're kidding.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: We'd have a long weekend just to sit in the sun, drink fruity drinks, and swim, and...  You know...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: This weekend?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Julie, we're working a big run up here. It's been crazy. We probably have to go out again tonight. I don't think I can do it.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Will you try...for me, please?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Okay, I'll try. But, listen...  If I don't make it up, then you go ahead and have a great time.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Ray...please try. I really miss you.  Okay. Bye.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Ray...what are you doing?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Oh...it's not working right. You're home early.  Did I scare you?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Never do that again.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey -- I didn't know you were here. It's okay.  We got the refrigerator in. Come see.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I love it here.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It's gonna be great.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Checking the locks again?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: You know me to well.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: You're the most beautiful woman in the bar tonight, Jules.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Tyrell, you are an unstoppable force of nature.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: That's right. It's how the species survives. You'll never convince me otherwise.  Wanna dance?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I am not crazy, Tyrell. He was right there.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Fine. Show me the body.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: We're all going to die. He's going to kill us one by one.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Ben Willis.
